(42)81st Conclusions.Copy Ho,TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 81 (42).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S. W. 1, on Thursday, June 25, 1942, at 5 - 30 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Secretary of State for Dominion affairs and Deputy Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The following were also present:The Right Hon. S. M. Bruce,Accredited Representative of theGovernment of the Commonwealthof Australia.The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The Right Hon. Sir James Grigg,M.P., Secretary of State for War.The Right Hon. Lord Leathers,Minister of War Transport (Item 1).secretariat sir Edward Bridges.Mr. Norman Brook.minute no.1 Shipping situation Middle East ....Military situation.Contents.Subject.Page.100100[24008] shipping situation.(previous reference erence:W.M. (42) 80thConclusions,Minute 3.)1. The War Cabinet had before them a Joint Memorandumby the First Lord of the Admiralty and the Minister of war transport (W.P. (42) 265).A preliminary discussion took place which covered suchmatters as Forecasts of new merchant shipbuilding.Anticipated rates of losses, and the efficiencies of the convoy system.No conclusions were reached pending submission of the Reporton the operational aspects of the position by the Committeeappointed by the Chiefs of Staff.A Record of the main points dealt with in. discussion is contained in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet conclusions.. Middle East.MilitarySituation.(previous reference erence:W.M. (42) 78thConclusions.)2. The War Cabinet were given the latest information regarding the military situation in the Middle East, and authorised the despatch of telegrams to General Auchinleck and Air MarshalTedder.Great George Street, S. W. 1,June 25, 1942.
